это; эти; (обычно пр. [zhei4] перед классификатором, особенно в Пекине)

這個 [ zhè ge ]: this; this one
這樣 [ zhè yàng ]: this kind of; so; this way; like this; such
這些 [ zhè xiē ]: these
這裡 [ zhè lǐ ]: here
這麼 [ zhè me ]: so much; this much; how much?; this way; like this

heisig_chinese_memo: There are words written on the road, but you have to crawl along to read them: 'If...you...can...read...this...you...look...silly...'.
Ru_trainchinese:
zhè: (местоим) (используется перед существительным или отдельно в качестве подлежащего или дополнения) этот, эти; сейчас, в этот момент
zhèi: (местоим) этот, эти (вариант произношения 这 zhe4)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the words (言) are moving (辶) but they're only crawling
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The highlander chose THIS road in life.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The original meaning is used as a pronoun, referring to a relatively recent time, place or thing, as opposed to " that ". " This " is not found in Jiajin inscriptions and "Shuowen", "Zengyun·Ma Yun": "Here, whoever calls this 箇 is a 箇, the common folks use this instead." According to this, " this " is a consonant sound word. In the Tang Dynasty, Lu Tong "Send Haoyue Master to Jiangnan": "To report to Jiangnan for three or two days, I saw the man in the snow for this response."

" This " can also be used as a supplementary word for the literary theory of Jin and Yuan tunes. It is located in the middle of the sentence and has no real meaning. For example, Guan Hanqing in Yuan Dynasty's "Xie Tianxiang": "Waiting for the Tao is madly sleeping, and the sun is not green."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The original meaning is used as a pronoun, referring to a relatively recent time, place or thing.
humanum_full_description:
本義作代詞，指代較近的時間、地點或事物，與「那」相對。「這」不見於甲金文及《說文》，《贈韻·馬韻》：「這，凡稱此箇為者箇，俗多改用這。」據此說法，「這」為合音詞。唐代盧仝〈送好約法師歸江南〉：「為報江南三二日，這回應見雪中人」。

　　「這」亦可作金、元曲文理的襯字，位於語句中間，無實義，如元代關漢卿《謝天香》：「待道是癲狂睡囈，兀的不青天這白日。」
humanum_short_description: 本義作代詞，指代較近的時間、地點或事物。

本義作代詞，指代較近的時間、地點或事物，與「 那 」相對。「 這 」不見於甲金文及《說文》，《贈韻·馬韻》：「這，凡稱此箇為者箇，俗多改用這。」據此說法，「 這 」為合音詞。唐代盧仝〈送好約法師歸江南〉：「為報江南三二日，這回應見雪中人」。 「 這 」亦可作金、元曲文理的襯字，位於語句中間，無實義，如元代關漢卿《謝天香》：「待道是癲狂睡囈，兀的不青天這白日。」
Elaboration: The original meaning is used as a pronoun, referring to a relatively recent time, place or thing, as opposed to " that". " This" is not found in Jiajin inscriptions and "Shuowen", "Zengyun·Ma Yun": "Here, whoever calls this 箇 is a 箇, the common folks use this instead." According to this, " this" is a consonant sound word. In the Tang Dynasty, Lu Tong "Send Haoyue Master to Jiangnan": "To report to Jiangnan for three or two days, I saw the man in the snow for this response." " This" can also be used as a supplementary word for the literary theory of Jin and Yuan tunes. It is located in the middle of the sentence and has no real meaning. For example, Guan Hanqing in Yuan Dynasty's "Xie Tianxiang": "Waiting for the Tao is madly sleeping, and the sun is not green."

這字的基本解释

這
zhè

這字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhè］
［《增韻》止也切，上馬］
“这1”的繁体字。
(1)代词。指示或代替比较近的人、事物或处所。
(2)代词。犹这么，这样。有加强语气的作用。
(3)代词。指现在。有加强语气的作用。
(4)代词。犹这个。表示训斥或夸张。
(5)曲中衬字。
(6)助词。表示语塞。
[②]［yàn］
［《廣韻》魚變切，去線，疑。］
“这2”的繁体字。
迎接，迎讶。
[③]［zhèi］
“这3”的繁体字。
在口语里，“这”单用或后面直接跟名词时，读zhè。“这”后面跟量词或数词加量词时，常读zhèi，例如：这程子，这个，这会儿，这些，这样，等等。

這字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【辵字部】　這； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1258第01
【廣韻】魚變切【集韻】牛堰切，?音彥。【玉篇】迎也。【正字通】周禮有掌訝，主迎。訝古作這。毛晃曰：凡稱此箇爲者箇，俗多攺用這字。這乃迎也。

這字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
這字的起名意思

暂无。

This
Basic explanation of words
This
zhè
This
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhè］
["Zeng Yun" cuts and cuts, go on horse]
"This 1" in traditional characters.
(1) Pronouns. Instruct or substitute for a closer person, thing or place.
(2) Pronouns. It's like this, this way. It has the effect of strengthening the tone.
(3) Pronouns. Refers to now. It has the effect of strengthening the tone.
(4) Pronouns. Still this. Indicates reprimand or exaggeration.
(5) Lining words in the song.
(6) Particles. Indicates that the language is blocked.
[②]［yàn］
["Guangyun" the fish is cut, and the line is removed, suspicious. ]
"This 2" in traditional characters.
Welcome, welcome surprise.
[③]［zhèi］
"This 3" in traditional characters.
In spoken language, when "this" is used alone or directly followed by a noun, pronounce zhè. When "this" is followed by a quantifier or a numeral plus a quantifier, it is often pronounced zhèi, for example: this Chengzi, this, now, these, this, etc.
This
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[You Ji 2] [The Department of Characters] 　 This; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1258 No. 01
[Guangyun] Fish change cut [Jiyun] Niuyan cut,? Yin Yan. [Jade articles] Welcome. [Zhengzitong] Zhou Li was surprised and welcomed. Surprised that Gu made this. Mao Huang said: Everyone who calls this qi is called qi, and it is often used by the common people. This is Ying Ye.
